intro: Tium sheldonii, commonly known as the Sheldon's tium, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powder. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Tium sheldonii is considered a conservation concern.
